Subject: Advice needed on how to (properly) structure new Heritrix modify

Hi folks,

I'm about to go deep on a project to add support for processing 
modifications and deletions for Heritrix, and I'm looking for input as 
to how best to proceed on this.

The project basically will involve two stages

First, I would be building into the Heritrix infrastructure the means of 
detecting changes to pages, and also detecting deletions of pages. 
These conditions would have to be signalled in some way to all Writers. 
  Alternatively, since backwards compatibility might be a problem, it's 
potentially possible that a new kind of Writer-like module would need to 
be created.  I was going to look at the adaptive frontier to see how 
exactly it handled changes, if indeed it does anything special at all. 
As far as I know, though, there's no signalling pathway in Heritrix at 
all for handling deletions, so that would have to be added, hopefully in 
  an approved manner.

The second phase would involve marrying the BdbFrontier with the 
Adaptive frontier.  The goal is to set the crawler up so that it 
dynamically and cost-effectively performs a synchronization over an 
extended time.  I looked at the BdbFrontier and discovered that there 
was actually not much going on in this module, per-se.  In fact, I found 
that the frontier interface itself is not at all what I expected.  Is 
there any design documents or anything you can throw my way that would 
help me understand how the BdbFrontier works, and what I might need to 
do to accomplish my goal?

I've done a fair bit of modification already (to support NTLM, http 1.1, 
etc.), but this goes into areas I'm not that familiar with.


Thanks very much,
Karl Wright
